Vocabularies.Definition: meet or discover by chance 偶然遇见，碰上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We've just come across an old friend we haven't seen for ages.

Vocabularies.Definition: manage to see or read 辨认出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I could barely make out the traffic signs through the rain.

Vocabularies.Definition: want and expect (sth.) 希望，期待
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I hope for going to college.
e.g.  The police found a clue which will help them catch the robber.
e.g.  The police are still uncertain of the murderer's identity.

Vocabularies.Definition: (forbade or forbad, forbidden) vt. 禁止，不许;妨碍
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Smoking is forbidden in the concert hall.
e.g.  There's nobody here other than me.
e.g.  Let's exchange our views on the matter.

Vocabularies.Definition: be as good as ( sb. or sth.) 与...一样好;比得上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  My new dress matches up to the one you have.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml) certainly so, without doubt 毫无疑问

Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I felt great relief when I heard I had passed the examination.

Vocabularies.Definition: finish 结束 e.g.  What time does the concert come to an end?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What time does the concert come to an end?
e.g.  tie a knot in a piece of string

Vocabularies.Definition: a. upright, standing on end 挺直的，直立的 vt. 使直立
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. This monument was erected in honor of the martyrs during the internal war.
